title: VDR 2014 Very Dark Red (Hames Valley)
description: This blend of 63% Petit Verdot and 37% Petite Sirah is indeed dark, with savory herbs of thyme and sage spicing up the dense blueberry and chocolate aromas. The palate is somewhat simple, offering ripe blackberry juice and a touch of chaparral spice.

title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Grande Cadole  (Bourgogne)
description: This young wine is all fruit. With its citrus acidity and crisp texture, it is bright, lively with a mineral edge to the attractive structure. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2016 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne Aligoté)
description: A crisp and fruity wine, this is full of citrus and lightly herbal flavors. It is tangy with layers of acidity as well as minerality from the chalk soil of the vineyards. Floral and full of fruit, the wine is ready to drink now.

title: Viña Bisquertt 2015 La Joya Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Roasted, herbal berry aromas come with more than a hint of animal. This feels full and weighty, which is normal for Carmenère. Gamy, herbal berry flavors are meaty and oaky prior to a drying, tannic finish.

title: Viña Maipo 2015 Gran Devoción Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Aromas of match stick and green herbs don't deliver much fruit. This feels round and regular, with grassy flavors along with hints of green bean and canned pea. Unresolved pyrazines on the finish result in an herbal, green flavor.

title: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2013 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)
description: Underbrush, grilled herb, camphor and toasted notes lead the nose of this wine. The palate is raw, showing unripe cherry, orange peel and clove flavors alongside bracing tannins.

title: CarlindePaolo 2016 Cursus Vitae  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: This informal red has delicate black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The simple palate suggests black plum and clove, with a touch of tobacco. It's not very intense and already extremely accessible, so drink soon.

title: Cascina Radice 2015 Roccanera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: This leads with subtle black plum and cooking spice scents. The simple palate shows clove, tobacco and blackberry flavors. Drink soon.

title: Castello di Neive 2014  Barbaresco
description: Aromas suggesting cellar floor, camphor and paraffin lead the nose of this wine. The camphor note follows through to the lean palate, along with red berry, ground clove and powdered sage flavors. Bracing tannins leave an astringent, drying finish.

title: Clos Pons 2015 Jan Petit Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are also stalky and gamy, a likely reflection of the 75% Syrah in this blend with Garnacha. A hard, grabby palate holds flavors of herbal plum and grape skins, while an obtuse finish tastes a little green.

title: Coleccion Privada 2015 Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)
description: Leathery red-fruit aromas turn more gritty and earthy with airing. This feels chunky and full, without much elegance. Plum and rubbery berry flavors finish with a chocolaty oak note.

title: Cuyen 2016 Merlot (Central Valley)
description: Minty berry aromas settle well and hold up to airing. This everyday Merlot is more than competent on the palate. Berry and spice flavors finish chewy, with standard ripeness and follow through.

title: Dante Rivetti 2012 Bricco di Neive Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's oak, toasted nut and menthol aromas carry over to its evolved palate, along with a coffee note and bracing tannins. It's shy on fruit richness and intensity.

title: Wild Pig 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)
description: Light scents of fresh grass, white flowers, waxy melon and sweet orange dance in the bouquet of this easy-drinking white. Those notes continue through to the fruity palate, with a pleasant roundness to the midpalate. Drink now.

title: Waterbrook 2016 Mélange Founder's White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Riesling and Gewürztraminer make up over half of this wine, giving it an aromatic punch. Vibrant ripe peach, flower and pear scents lead to an off-dry palate with fleshy fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal, though the concentration, especially through the midpalate, seems light.

title: TerraNoble 2013 Reserva Terroir La Higuera Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Heavy aromas of herbal berry fruits and wood smoke are rustic. This wine feels resiny and edgy, while saucy, oaky flavors of pancetta and tomato finish with notes of sausage, fennel and bacon.

title: La Spinetta 2013 Vigneto Bordini  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's oak, weedy underbrush, celery and vegetable broth aromas carry over to the lean palate, along with a roasted coffee bean note. Raspy tannins clench the finish.

title: Punset 2012 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with prune, menthol, nail varnish and plastic aromas. The palate is tired and evolved, showing dried black cherry and fig flavors, with a hint of orange peel and worn tannins. It finishes short.

title: Pietro Rinaldi 2013 Santo Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's nose suggests game, forest floor, truffle and leather. It's tight and raw, offering roasted coffee bean, powdered sage, licorice and unripe cherry notes set against a backdrop of raspy tannins and firm acidity.

title: San Pedro 2016 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Green, lightly vegetal aromas of pole beans and canned peas lead to a palate with moderate acidity and pop. A briny mix of citrus and vegetal flavors carries over to the finish.

title: ZinPhomaniac 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Waffles and maple syrup in the aroma, and blackberries in the flavor seem to recommend this full-bodied wine for breakfast time. In fact it is a little sweet, and those maple-like notes continue in the flavors along with vanilla and cinnamon.

title: Veglio 2015  Dolcetto d'Alba
description: Black-skinned fruit, underbrush and game aromas lead the nose of this wine. The round, simple palate evokes mature black cherry and clove. Drink soon.

title: Araldica 2015 Castelvero Albera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: Subdued aromas of dried black fruit and baking spice set the tone in this wine. Its easygoing, straightforward palate offers mature Morello cherry and vanilla flavors alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Austerity 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: This bottling is very showy on the nose with tons of white flowers, tuberose, guava and mango, though a slice of lime peel cuts the tropicality a bit. Guava peel, feijoa and bitter limes show on the sip, where that slightly treacly tropicality reigns.

title: Château Rimauresq 2014 Cru Classé Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is fruity with attractive black currants. The tannins are very present, suggesting the wine is young. It is a wine with potential, so drink from 2019.

title: Cielo 2016 Estate Viognier (Saddle Rock-Malibu)
description: Extremely light on the nose, there are faint whiffs of yellow pear and lemon on this bottling from the Los Angeles coast. Yellow-apple skins, dried apple flesh and lime peels show on the sip, which is cut by a decent acidity and proves a straightforward take on the grape.

title: Cebada 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A pretty pale pink in color, this bottling is very yeasty, reminiscent of a sparkling wine, also showing sour strawberry, wet stone and orange peel on the nose. The yeast is prominent through the sip, dominating the sharp kumquat and pink-fruit flavors.

title: Chandler Reach 2013 Brevetatta Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This blend of 70% Syrah, 10% Merlot and 10% Sangiovese delivers vanilla, shaved coconut and dark fruit aromas. It's full bodied, with fruit and barrel-derived flavors that linger on the finish. The oak influence is cumbersome.

title: Ca' de Lion Ghione 2014 Le Muccie  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: This opens with restrained cooking spice and dark-skinned berry aromas. The lively, informal palate offers red cherry, white pepper and anise hints, with soft tannins and brisk acidity. Drink soon.

title: Cascina Radice 2015 S. Martino  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: This wine's subdued baking spice, clove and mature black-skinned fruit aromas follow through to the lively, simple palate. Round tannins provide easygoing support. Drink soon.
